trigger_event: Rada receives a cache of encrypted BCI logs and urgent appeals from both resistance groups and nervous Council members as blackouts and ghost citizen unrest grip the city.
dilemma: Rada must decide whether to secretly broker a nightly BCI shutdown—giving people true privacy—or publicly expose the BCI’s hidden protocol and spark a citywide rebellion.
reason: Rada knows her decision could either foster fragile trust and real safety or ignite chaos and irreversible upheaval. As a journalist, her role is to reveal truths—yet after an emotional midnight conversation with Alex, she questions if a well-timed compromise might offer the most hope.
choice_a: Quietly negotiate and announce the 'Network Blackout Accord,' securing nightly BCI shutdowns that allow Stenograd’s citizens short windows of real privacy and the chance to rebuild trust.
belief_a: Small protected freedoms can lead to big change.
People need space to heal and reconnect without fear.
Building bridges—even in secret—is sometimes braver than open confrontation.
choice_b: Broadcast the BCI’s hidden rebellion protocol to the public, forcing the system’s secret autonomy into the open and shattering the Council’s grip on power.
belief_b: Radical honesty is the only path to true freedom.
Only by pulling back the curtain can citizens choose their own fate.
Disrupting the system’s control will break old chains forever.
